title: National Vigils Take Place to Honour Bondi Beach Terror Attack Victims | 10 News
description: There were tense scenes as thousands gathered at memorials around the country last night, to honour the Bondi victims - exactly one week after the terrorist attack.  At a community vigil in Bondi - The Prime Minister was booed, a man was 'moved on' after trying to rush at him, while the New South Wales Premier was given a standing ovation.  But the overwhelming message - this is a time for unity. title: Chris Minns Government Pushes for Tough Gun Laws to Be Passed Before Christmas | 10 News
description: New South Wales could be home to the toughest gun laws in Australia before Christmas if new reforms are fast-tracked through parliament.   The proposed Bill, which has bundled together protest, terrorist symbol and gun reforms is still being debated and despite some criticism is expected to pass the lower house later tonight. description: Mitchell Starc has the International Cricket Council in his sights, now Australia has secured the Ashes. title: Russian General Killed In Moscow Car Bomb As Ukraine War Ceasefire Talks Stall | 10 News
description: A senior Russian general has been killed after a car bomb exploded in a residential district of southern Moscow, heightening tensions amid stalled peace efforts.  Lieutenant General Fanil Sarvarov, head of the Russian General Staff’s training department, died when an explosive device detonated beneath his parked SUV.  Investigators say the attack bears the hallmarks of previous assassinations linked to Ukraine, though Kyiv has not commented on the blast.  The killing comes as Moscow reports slow progress in US-brokered ceasefire talks aimed at ending the nearly four-year war in Ukraine. title: Venezuela Accuses US Of Piracy After Oil Tanker Seizures & Naval Blockade | 10 News
description: Venezuela has described the US seizure of two oil tankers off its coast as "piracy" after the Trump administration intercepted multiple vessels in international waters.  Venezuela Foreign Minister Yvan Gil read a letter from President Nicolas Maduro addressed to Latin American and Caribbean leaders and United Nations member states, warning of an escalation of US aggression  In the statement, Venezuela reaffirmed its commitment to peace and urged the international community to condemn these acts and defend international law.  The move follows days after US President Donald Trump announced a “blockade” of all sanctioned oil tankers entering and leaving Venezuela. title: Sinkhole Traps Boats In Shropshire Canal | 10 News
description: A massive sinkhole has opened in a canal in England’s Shropshire county, trapping two boats in deep mud and damaging a third.  Emergency services declared a major incident after a significant breach of the Shropshire Union Canal in Whitchurch.  More than 10 people were rescued as crews worked through unstable ground and rapidly moving water, with no injuries reported.  The affected section of the canal has been dammed off while investigators work to determine the cause of the collapse. title: Trump Says US Needs Greenland For National Security | 10 News
description: President Donald Trump has renewed calls to take over Greenland, stating the United States needs to have the country, not for critical minerals but for “national security”.  It follows Trump naming Louisiana Governor Jeff Landry as his special envoy to the self-governing Danish territory on Sunday, sparking new tensions between the nation’s leaders.  Denmark’s Foreign Minister Lars Lokke Rasmussen stating, “I am very upset about this appointment of a special envoy. And I am particularly upset about the envoy's statements, which we find completely unacceptable." title: Islamic Prayer Hall in Sydney’s Southwest Shut Down Amid Hate Speech Crackdown | 10 News
description: A controversial Islamic prayer hall has been shut down by a Southwest Sydney council which says it was being run 'illegally' as state and federal leaders crack down on hate speech in the wake of the Bondi attack.     It comes as the federal government reveals what its gun and hate speech reforms will look like.  But the Prime Minister is continuing to resist calls for a Commonwealth Royal Commission. title: NSW Pushes Ahead With Toughest-in-Country Gun & Protest Reforms Amid Legal Challenges | 10 News
description: The New South Wales government is pushing ahead with its sweeping gun and protest crackdown.   An all-night parliamentary sitting saw the lower house pass reforms billed as being the toughest in the country.  But today - as it was fiercely debated in the upper house - a constitutional challenge in the courts, was already being mounted. title: Senior Russian General Killed In Moscow Car Bomb, Zelenskyy Fears Possible Russian Strike | 10 News
description: A senior Russian general has been killed by a car bomb in Moscow, in what the Kremlin suspects was a targeted assassination by Ukraine. title: Libyan Army Chief Mohammed Al-Haddad Dies In Türkiye Plane Crash | 10 News
description: Libya’s army chief of staff, Mohammed Ali Ahmed al-Haddad, has died after a military jet crashed shortly after departing Türkiye’s capital, Ankara.  Turkish authorities said the jet requested an emergency landing before crashing in a rural district south of Ankara, with debris later located by search teams.  Libya’s prime minister said radio contact was lost with the aircraft as it travelled to Tripoli, carrying Haddad and four others.  The cause of the crash is not yet known. The incident comes a day after Türkiye extended the mandate of its military deployment in Libya, where it backs the Tripoli-based government.
